intro: Lindsaea hosei, commonly known as the Hosen's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Lindsaeaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant has small, scale-like leaves and produces inconspicuous greenish-white flowers. It relies on host trees for water and nutrients, while still performing some photosynthesis. Its unique ecological role makes it an important species in tropical forest ecosystems.
